answer_found_by_llm: The suspicious process identified is powershell.exe (PID 3692). This process exhibits clear malicious behavior as it runs with a hidden window style and attempts to connect to an external IP address (45.9.74.32) while trying to load a remote DLL file (3435.dll) through WebDAV. The command line arguments used by this process indicate an attempt to establish unauthorized network connections and execute potentially malicious code, which are typical characteristics of malware or attack tools.
The Parent Process ID (PPID) of the suspicious PowerShell process (PID 3692) is 4120.
The second-stage payload file used by the malware is 3435.dll, which was being loaded remotely through a WebDAV share.
The shared directory accessed by the malicious process is "davwwwroot", which was being accessed through a WebDAV connection at \\45.9.74.32@8888\davwwwroot\.
The malicious process is running under the username "Elon"
